[@nanomonkey](@+D0ku/LReK6kqd3PSrcVCfbLYbDtTmS4Bd21rqhpYNA=.ed25519)

I've been shaving my head every Sunday and it's been going well, but I'm not sure how to balance the pros and cons of not having hair. On one hand, having super short hair makes it *very* difficult to mess up. On the other hand, I think having hair is conventional and more "normal" for most people I interact with. Hats are probably a solid middle ground, but I've never really tried them for more than a few hours.

That's basically the same routine I'd been using when I had long hair, but eventually I started getting dandruff and realized that spending a ton of money to maintain a pain-in-the-ass haircut didn't really align with how I'd like to live my life. Doctor Bronners and orange pumice soap are the best, I love them both.

Just checked out that channel and it looks really sweet, I just subscribed. I've been trying to stick to buying only produce and bulk foods at the grocery store, but being able to extend that to *all* store-bought products would be fantastic. Hell, I'd *love* to make my own medications but I'd rather not have The Authorities kicking down my door for manufacturing over-the-counter drugs. :pill:
